Hi all,

While performing Incremental Crawling, it seems like Heritrix chec=
ks
the current queue, if a document has already been fetched (by checking
i=
ts content hash) but does not check if the same document has been
fetched f=
rom another website. 

How should this be handled in the clustered version =
(multiple machines
running Heritrix)? 

For example: Some mirror sites usua=
lly have the same content but
different urls.
 
These URLs would be waiting=
 in different queues. 
 
Each queue will first fetch a document.
 
Then, cr=
eate a hash of their contents and check the value against the
saved hash va=
lues in CrawlURI objects only in their respective queues.
It doesnt check i=
f the other queues already contain a CrawlURI object
with the same hashvalu=
e.
 
  
So, how should this be handled ?

With regards,
Shadab
